title: Our Student Union politicians need to stop this absurd crusade to block Brexit through the courts
text:
A casual observer of the ongoing legal proceedings in Scotland, brought against the Prime Minister by Remainer QCs Jo Maugham and Joanna Cherry, might have been forgiven for thinking that today was going to be the day: that Boris Johnson would be found in contempt of court – to be immediately fined, sentenced to prison, and (possibly) forced to undertake 6 years of hard labour in Siberia.

The narrative has, however, borne very little relation to reality, and the constant references to contempt of court are all smoke and mirrors. Boris complied with his duties under the Benn Act by sending, under sufferance, the necessary letter to the EU on Saturday night – a point recognised by Gina Miller...
description: A casual observer of the ongoing legal proceedings in Scotland, brought against the Prime Minister by Remainer QCs Jo Maugham and Joanna Cherry, might have been forgiven for thinking that today was going to be the day:
